Package it.polimi.demo.model.board

Class PersonalBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.demo.model.board.PersonalBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PersonalBoard extends Object implements Serializable
This class represents the personal board of a player.

  • Method Details

    • updatePoints

      public void updatePoints(ResourceCard card)
      Updates the player's points by adding the points from the specified resource card.
      Parameters:
      card - The resource card from which points are to be added.

    • updatePoints

      public void updatePoints(GoldCard card)
      Updates the player's points based on the conditions specified by the provided Gold Card. If the card requires feathers, points are increased based on the number of feathers the player has. If the card requires parchments, points are increased based on the number of parchments the player has. If the card requires potions, points are increased based on the number of potions the player has. If the card requires corner coverage, points are increased based on the number of corners covered by level 2 resources on the player's board.
      Parameters:
      card - The Gold Card specifying the conditions for updating points.

    • addFixedResource

      public void addFixedResource(Color color)
      Adds a fixed resource of a specified color to the player's inventory. Increments the count of the corresponding resource type based on the color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the resource to be added.

    • bruteForcePlaceCardSE

      public void bruteForcePlaceCardSE(ResourceCard card, int i, int j)
      This method simply put a card at position (i,j) of the board without doing any check. It is used only for tests. SE because we use a classic for loop with increasing indexes both for i and j.
      Parameters:
      card -

    • placeStarterCard

      public void placeStarterCard(StarterCard card)

    • placeCardAtNE

      public boolean placeCardAtNE(ResourceCard game_card, ResourceCard card_to_play)
      We assume that the game_card's corners have a specified board_coordinate,
      Parameters:
      game_card - is the card already on the PersonalBoard
      card_to_play - is the card to put on the PersonalBoard ensures card_to_play is attached to another card, specifically in the NE corner of the game_card

    • placeCardAtNE

      public boolean placeCardAtNE(ResourceCard game_card, GoldCard card_to_play)
      overloading: We assume that the game_card's corners have a specified board_coordinate,
      Parameters:
      game_card - is the card already on the PersonalBoard
      card_to_play - is the card to put on the PersonalBoard ensures card_to_play is attached to another card, specifically in the NE corner of the game_card

    • placeCardAtNE

      public boolean placeCardAtNE(StarterCard game_card, ResourceCard card_to_play)
      overloading: This method assumes that the corners of the game card have specified board coordinates. It is utilized when placing a new ResourceCard (@param card_to_play) onto a corner of the personal board where a corner of the StarterCard already exists.
      Parameters:
      game_card - is the card already on the PersonalBoard
      card_to_play - is the card to put on the PersonalBoard ensures card_to_play is attached to another card, specifically in the NE corner of the game_card

    • placeCardAtNE

    • generalUpdateRoutine

      public void generalUpdateRoutine(int i, int j, Cell[][] board, ResourceCard card_to_play)
      Performs a general update routine on the player's board based on the placement of a resource card. It updates the board cells and coordinates, adds or removes resources/items as necessary, and handles the orientation of the resource card.
      Parameters:
      i - The row index of the starting position on the board for placing the resource card.
      j - The column index of the starting position on the board for placing the resource card.
      board - The 2D array representing the player's board.
      card_to_play - The resource card to be placed on the board.

      public Cell[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the player's board.
